name: Bubble Yu
headline: Off Season | HOSIS Patent Holder | CS @ Stanford
about:
Hi, I'm Bubble! I'm an SF-based Stanford builder working on human-computer interaction in multiple fields, from racetrack telemetry to wearable language translation. I enjoy working on high-tech systems, from turning raw sensor signals into actionable interfaces for high-performance use cases in motorsport, to hardware solutions for accessibility and photogrammetry 3D modeling for competitive climbing.

I'm currently at Founders, Inc. building an ASL-to-speech module using a high-resolution IMU ring. In my free time this summer, I'm working on a smart mobile companion to AiM MyChron dataloggers with GoPro-Telemetry sync and 3D reconstructed laps.

Outside of work, I like to climb and am a former racing driver for Team VR in the KA100 and X30 engine categories 锔
